DOC.brief_summary: Cervical paravertebral block ( CPVBs ) target brachial plexus puncture site situate posterior aspect neck represent alternative interscalene block ( ISBs ) shoulder proximal humeral surgery . Randomized controlled trial compare CPVB ISB find significant difference success rate , onset offset time . Because reliability cutaneous landmark , CPVBs become part investigator ' standard practice . With approach , brachial approach identify either loss resistance air ( LOR ) nerve stimulation ( NS ) . While author use LOR report good success rate , others hypothesize NS may increase reliability block . In proposed study , first time , 2 method formally compare .
DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Between Neurostimulation Loss Resistance Cervical Paravertebral Blocks
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria : age 18 70 year American Society Anesthesiologists classification 13 body mass index 20 28 Exclusion criterion : adult unable give consent preexist obstructive restrictive lung disease ( assessed history physical examination ) preexist neuropathy ( assessed history physical examination ) coagulopathy ( assessed history physical examination , deem clinically necessary , blood work ie platelets≤ 100 , International Normalized Ratio≥ 1.4 prothrombin time ≥ 50 ) renal failure ( assessed history physical examination , deem clinically necessary , blood work ie creatinine≥ 100 ) hepatic failure ( assessed history physical examination , deem clinically necessary , blood work ie transaminases≥ 100 ) allergy local anesthetic agent ( LA ) pregnancy prior cervical spine surgery
